metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17053 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
ieee802154_create in net/ieee802154/socket.c in the AF_IEEE802154 networkmodule in the Linux kernel through 5.3.2 does not enforce CAP_NET_RAW,which means that unprivileged users can create a raw socket, akaCID-e69dbd4619e7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17053` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-kvm - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1006-azure - 5.4.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-gcp - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-oracle - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-raspi2 - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1007-oem - 5.4.0-1002.4
No subscription required
